It happens when the model captures the noise along with the underlying pattern in data Models with underfitting usually have high bias and low variance. It happens when we have very less amount of data to build an accurate model Model capacity model capacity â€¢ allows you to control the probability of a model falling into underfitting or overfitting â€¢ low capacity model will be not be able to achieve a good fit to the training data (underfitting) â€¢ too high capacity model will memorize training data, but it will not generalize (overfitting) Model capacity (ii)A case study: shopping cart A supermarket chainâ€¦ â€¢ sells millions of products to millions of customers â€¢ for each transaction stores: date, customer, products and quantities, cost, â€¦ â€¢ raw data impossible to manage â€¢ then, why store so much data? Objective: to learn from historical data how to predict future events What can be learned? â€¢ what customer profiles exist (pensioners, students, families, â€¦) â€¢ correlations between customer profiles, products, days of the week, dates of the year, weather, etc. â€¢ correlations between products (beer + chips, cava + chocolates, diapers + wipes, etc.) What can be predicted? â€¢ how much of a certain product will be sold on a given day A case study: shopping cart Given a future date f, we want to predict how much of a product p will be sold on day f A case study: shopping cart Stages, steps: â€¢ to collect historical data â€¢ to set assumptions â€¢ to define the representation of the elements of the problem â€¢ to estimate or predict the value of the target variable â€¢ to evaluate estimates (and the method chosen) â€¢ to refine the solution method A case study: shopping cart Data: what past experiences could be useful to us? â€¢ example: given the same date f of some previous year â€¦ â€“ how much of product p was sold on day f? â€“ how much of product p was sold on day f-1? â€“ what day of the week (Monday, Tuesday) was f? â€“ what were the weather conditions (temperature, general condition, humidity, wind, ...)? â€“ what was the retail price of product p? â€“ has the retail price of p changed from previous days? How did it change? â€“ what was the economic situation (unemployment rate, Euribor, ...)?
